intro: Antennaria cinnamomea var. angustior, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, white or pinkish flowers. The leaves are typically linear and arranged in a rosette pattern, adapted to thrive in sandy or rocky soils. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. The plant's botanical features reflect its ability to survive in arid environments with minimal water availability.
